data.title: HKU Faculty of Architecture
data.meta_description: Founded in 1912, The University of Hong Kong is the leading and oldest tertiary institute in Hong Kong. In the early years, the University was host to four Faculties: Arts, Engineering, Medicine and Science. The late 1940’s and the 1950’s were characterized by the city’s dramatic expansion due to emigration from China and the needs of the industry. The Department of Architecture was first introduced into the University in 1950, under the Deanship of Professor R. Gordon Brown. The first five-year Degree of Bachelor of Architecture was awarded in 1955. In 1958, Professor W. G. Gregory was appointed Dean until the School was amalgamated into the Faculty of Engineering and Architecture in the same year. Professional recognition of the degree was granted by the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) in 1961 and joint visitations ran parallel with the Commonwealth Architects Association (CAA), the Architect’s Registration Council of the United Kingdom (ARCUK) and the Hong Kong Institute of Architects (HKIA). CAA recognition was received in 1968. Graduate studies in architecture resulted in the first PhD and MPhil degrees being awarded in 1969 and 1970 respectively.
data.text:
Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Enhancing Underground Development Users’ Health through an Automated Risk Assessment System for Facilities Management’ funded by General Research Fund (GRF), Research Grant Council (RGC), HKSAR, 2021-24.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Enhancing Underground Development Users’ Health through a Holistic Facilities Management Model: Empirical Evidence from On-site Studies and a Virtual Experiment’ funded by Early Career Scheme, Research Grant Council (RGC), HKSAR, 2019-22.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Underground Facilities Management and Occupant Health: Case Studies in Hong Kong’ funded by Seed Fund for Basic Research, University of Hong Kong (HKU), 2019-21.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Review of Adoption of New Engineering Contract (NEC) in Public Works Projects in Hong Kong’ funded by Development Bureau (DEVB), HKSAR, 2019-20.

Co-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Comparison of Practice in Construction Industry between Hong Kong and the Mainland’ funded by Development Bureau (DEVB), HKSAR, 2019-20.

Co-Principal Investigator for the project entitled: ‘A Review of the Current RISC (Request for Inspection and Survey Checking) Forms Mechanism in Hong Kong’ funded by Hong Kong Construction Association (HKCA), 2019-20.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Enhancing the Research-teaching Nexus by Incorporating BIM in Sustainable Construction Teachings to Enrich Learning Outcomes’ under Teaching Development Grant (TDG), HKU, 2018-19.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Tangible Benefits of Green Commercial and Residential Development’ funded by the Pacific (Asia) Association of Quantity Surveyors (PAQS), 2018.

Co-Principal Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Sustainable Development Worldwide: Assessment Standards, Policies & Costs of Green Commercial & Residential Buildings’ funded by Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors (HKIS), 2016-17.

Co-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘The Influence of National and Organizational Culture on Innovation in Facilities Management: Case study comparison of public healthcare organisations in Hong Kong and the United Kingdom’ under Seed Funding for Basic Research, HKU, 2016-2018.

Co-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Learning and Teaching Professional Competence in the Built Environment using Serious Video Game Technology’ under TDG, HKU, 2015-17.

Principal-Investigator for the project entitled: ‘Fostering Innovation in Facilities Management in the Public Healthcare Sector: the Role of Organizational Culture, Leadership and the Cultural-Leadership Fit’ under Small Project Funding, The University of Hong Kong, 2014-2015.
